name: electricity, high voltage, import from GE | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7329/documentation

This dataset represents the amount of imported electricity from GE to TR. The import value includes all electricity imports, independently whether used within the importing country, or re-exported. For a discussion of different ways of modeling electricity trade in LCI, please refer to (Itten & Frischknecht 2012).;For structural reasons of the ecoinvent database the annual import volume is set to zero in this dataset. The import volume is considered directly in the respective high voltage electricity market of the importing geography.

This activity represents the point of 'handing over' the electricity from one country to the other at the border.

This dataset doesn't include any electricity losses or transmission infrastructure as these are accounted for in the market datasets.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: No market for electricity exists in the ecoinvent database for Georgia. The shares of the different technologies for electricity production in GE in 2012 were the following: Coal 0% Oil 0% Natural gas 25% Nuclear 0% Hydro 75% other technologies 0% These technologies are approximated with the global dataset for electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region (100%). Source: IEA. 2014. Statistics. Electricity and heat per country for 2012. Available on e.g. http://www.iea.org/statistics/statisticssearch/report/?country=AUSTRALI&product=electricityandheat&year=2012'
